Full.Name: Frank Morgan
Circumstance.Specific:
Lung Cancer
 Upon arrival, DFC Crawford made contact with a deputy from the previous shift in room# 3212. The Deputy informed DFC Crawford that the inmate being watched was Mr. Frank Morgan. The Deputy explained to DFC Crawford that Morgan was suffering from terminal lung cancer. The Deputy further explained that the hospital staff expected Morgan to perish in the upcoming days and they were trying keep him comfortable for the time being.
 Throughout the morning of the reported date, DFC Crawford and and hospital staff kept a close eye on Morgan. At approximately 1155 hours, DFC Crawford observed Morgan' s breathing to become more labored. Soon after, DFC Crawford observed that Morgan' s chest and stomach was no longer rising and falling, indicating that he was no longer taking breaths. DFC Crawford immediately notified the nearby nursing staff. At 1200 hours, Doctor MEDICAL arrived and conducted a vitals check, confirming that Morgan was in fact deceased and declared the time of death.
 DFC Crawford then contacted Sergeant Aaron Mendow via phone and informed him of the situation. In turn, Sergeant Mendow contacted the Major Crimes Division and the St. Tammany Parish Coroner's Office. At approximately 1315 hours members of the Coroner' s Office arrived at the hospital. After conducting their investigation, the Coroner' sOffice members took possession of Morgan's physical remains.
 Nothing further,
 Deputy First Class Dylan Crawford# 1217
